author: hmijail
content:
<@393119312350543872> and regarding the tests themselves: is there any policy or strategy to create them? Do they give any guarantee of coverage, any kind of "certification"? 
Or is it accurate to say that the only way to be sure that an EVM is correct is to run it on Mainnet?

author: dimitry8570
content:
Well it is about confidence interval of the tests coverage. Each time someone report a new case that broke something,  we cover more.

Actually the tests cover more situations that happen on main net. The guarantee here is that if you run them all, then you are in consensus with geth (generation  client)

Research here would be nice:
- run code coverage analysis (see how well the code paths in evm logic are covered on different clients when running all the tests)
- detect redundant tests
